description: {"blocks":[{"key":"27co7","text":"Genome editing using nucleases such as CRISPR-Cas induces programmable DNA damage at a target genomic site, but can also affect off-target sites. We develop a powerful assay for the unbiased identification of off-target sites that we term DISCOVER-seq. This approach takes advantage of the recruitment of endogenous DNA repair factors for genome-wide identification of Cas-induced double strand breaks. One such factor, MRE11, is recruited so precisely to a double stranded break that nuclease cut sites can be determined with single-base resolution. DISCOVER-seq is applicable to multiple types of Cas nucleases and provides an unprecedented molecular picture of events that precede repair of the affected sites. DISCOVER-seq furthermore detects off-targets in cellular models and tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: off-targets, CRISPR-Cas9, genome editing, ChIP-seq, MRE11, DNA repair
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8v65r","text":"Culture your cell line of interest so that you can edit 1x10^7 cells on the day of nucleofection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":56,"length":12,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e3h84","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"45ft6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rjbh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2v7a9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"9qn8r","text":"It's better to start with lots, if your cell type is tricky or you cannot get that many cells you can start with less. We have successfully done ChIP-Seq with 2x10^6 cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"8r9ll","text":"Best practice is to set up a control experiment of cells edited with a non-targeting gRNA. This sample should be processed the same way as the gRNA of interest. MRE11-ChIP from these cells will serve as a negative control for the analysis later and will help elimate false positives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"EF1F9960D5E611E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675715,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3791","text":"Harvest cells and spin down in falcon tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6E69F6C0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675717,"previous_id":675715,"previous_guid":"EF1F9960D5E611E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36hak","text":"After 8-24h of culture, harvest cells into falcon tube. Spin to pellet. Discard media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":6,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16j4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8o9f0","text":"IMPORTANT: Before you spin cells down, make sure to take a small split of the cells to keep in culture for a few more days. You will need these cells to later extract gDNA to check on mutation rates at off-target sites. We usually harvest cells for gDNA extraction 4 days post nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"963BC020D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675718,"previous_id":675767,"previous_guid":"646B6C80D5EC11E8863F551A53F5884F","section":"Crosslinking"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18k6","text":"Resuspend cells in 20ml of room temperature media (You can use IMDM or RPMI) without supplements. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":19,"length":30,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4al86","text":"Add 37% Formaldehyde to a final concentration of 1%. Incubate at RT for 15 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":49,"length":2,"style":"bold"},{"offset":72,"length":6,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"78onk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"441q0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"2fiue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d9pnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nhrk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"824g9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"5inmd","text":"Make sure you obtain a single cell suspension. For sticky or adherent cell types you can pass cells through a 23G needle with a syringe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"ckgh4","text":"Formaldehyde is toxic and the waste has to be disposed of correctly!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"966E8FF0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675719,"previous_id":675718,"previous_guid":"963BC020D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Crosslinking"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cjor","text":"Add 2.5 M glycine to quench formaldehyde (final 125mM). Leave a couple of minutes at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":48,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6l7t3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c33gd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"33fin","text":"Formaldehyde is toxic and the waste has to be disposed of correctly!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"966FEF80D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675720,"previous_id":675719,"previous_guid":"966E8FF0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Crosslinking"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"744k9","text":"Wash cells twice with 10 ml ice cold PBS (1200 g, 3 min spins \u2013 pour off S\/N each time). Transfer cells to a 15 mL falcon tube before last spin. Take off S\/N completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":22,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"967064B0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675721,"previous_id":675720,"previous_guid":"966FEF80D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Crosslinking"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hnoj","text":"Proceed with lysis, or snap freeze cells in liquid nitrogen and store pellets at \u221280 \u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":64,"length":23,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehdrs","text":"Crosslinked cell pellets can be stored at -80C for a few months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"96712800D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675723,"previous_id":675721,"previous_guid":"967064B0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Crosslinking"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f3rh","text":"Resuspend each pellet of crosslinked cells in 10 ml of LB1 (+protease inhibitors) (50 mM Hepes\u2013KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl; 1 mM EDTA; 10% Glycerol; 0.5% NP-40 or Igepal CA-630; 0.25% Triton X-100). Rock at 4 \u00b0C for 10 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":46,"length":12,"style":"bold"},{"offset":204,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"973vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d4u9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"a3lpe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":139583,"guid":"30600C00D6AC11E8AE8FBD1A311B6B73","align":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"100x Halt protease inhibitor cocktail","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"","sku":"78429","url":"https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/order\/catalog\/product\/78429","vendor":{"name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/us\/en\/home.html","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":95},"can_edit":0,"step_guid":"F32AA4E0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","public":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"F32AA4E0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675724,"previous_id":675791,"previous_guid":"C60A8B80D5EF11E89D8BEDCF70F4819B","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjc0v","text":"Resuspend each pellet in 10 ml of LB2 (+protease inhibitors)  (10 mM Tris\u2013HCL, pH8.0; 200 mM NaCl; 1 mM EDTA; 0.5 mM EGTA). Rock gently at 4 \u00b0C for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":25,"length":12,"style":"bold"},{"offset":139,"length":14,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F32C5290D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675725,"previous_id":675769,"previous_guid":"853D25F0D5EE11E8863F551A53F5884F","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mkde","text":"Resuspend each pellet in each tube in 1.5 ml LB3 (+protease inhibitors) in 2mL tube (10 mM Tris\u2013HCl, pH 8; 100 mM NaCl; 1 mM EDTA; 0.5 mM EGTA; 0.1% Na\u2013Deoxycholate; 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F32D15E0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675726,"previous_id":675771,"previous_guid":"A11AEFF0D5EE11E8863F551A53F5884F","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd9a","text":"Sonicate lysate 3x for 1 min on ice. Settings: 0.9 ON 0.1 OFF and 75% amplitude works for our sonicator.  Let samples rest on ice inbetween sonications. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":16,"length":12,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9urjr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpla9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"6l0k6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2pck9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8cesk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"3tii5","text":"The right sonication has to be determined experimentally. It varies between cell types, amount of cells used and between cell lines and tissues. it is good to do couple of test runs on unedited cells and run the sonicated products on a gel. The right sonication size is important as it determines the resolution of you ChIP-Seq experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"87uun","text":"You should see smear of DNA between 200-500bp, if you still have unsheared genomic DNA you will see a clear distinct band at high MW and also bigger products (>1000 bp). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"F3A9E700D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675727,"previous_id":675726,"previous_guid":"F32D15E0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvhn3","text":"Spin at 20,000 \u00d7 rcf for 10 min at 4 \u00b0C to pellet debris. Transfer S\/N to new falcon tube. Add 1.5ml of LB3 and 300ul of 10% Triton-X (final 1%). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":8,"length":31,"style":"bold"},{"offset":95,"length":13,"style":"bold"},{"offset":112,"length":21,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sv33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6le2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4u25d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"1ateb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"ah59d","text":"The amount of LB3 and Triton X-100 is adjusted to the number of ChIPs to be performed. For example to prepare 2 ChIPs from one 1.5 ml sonication you would top up the centrifuged sonication to 6 ml with LB3 and Triton X-100 to 1% final concentration. Mix well and transfer 3mL per IP to 15 ml conical tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"F3FDFA70D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675728,"previous_id":675727,"previous_guid":"F3A9E700D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"edlfi","text":"IMPORTANT: Save 2x 50 \u03bcl of cell lysate from each sonication as input DNA in screw cap tubes. Store at \u221220 \u00b0C until the next day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bqtdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ct2f","text":"Now you are ready for IP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F3FF0BE0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675729,"previous_id":675728,"previous_guid":"F3FDFA70D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97l0o","text":"Wash cells with 1ml PBS and transfer to eppendorf tube. Spin to pellet, discard S\/N","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":16,"length":7,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D5F57650D5E911E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675731,"previous_id":675717,"previous_guid":"6E69F6C0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ic50","text":"While cells are spinning: Prepare RNPs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rrpb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1f7v2","text":"Add Cas9 Buffer (20 mM HEPES (pH 7.5), 150 mM KCl, 1 mM MgCl2, 10% glycerol and 1 mM TCEP) such that final volume of all components comes to 15uL.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":11,"style":"bold"},{"offset":141,"length":4,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bph3c","text":"Add 30 pmol of Cas9 per one million cells (i.e. for 1x10^7 you need 300pmol Cas9)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3g6o0","text":"Add 30 pmol of sgRNA per one million cells (i.e. for 1x10^7 you need 300pmol gRNA)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fbri6","text":"Incubate at RT for 5-10 mins (or longer)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":19,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"10CF6150D5EA11E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675732,"previous_id":675731,"previous_guid":"D5F57650D5E911E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36h07","text":"Add 60ul of nucleofection buffer (Lonza) including supplements to your RNPs and pipette up and down. Transfer the whole volume into eppendorf tube with cell pellets and resuspend cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":29,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"38r6i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"60utb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k13t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3q4ih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"361bq","text":"The type of nucleofection buffer used depends on your cell type. Check Lonza guidelines for the right buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"7vnsh","text":"The amount of nucleofection buffer added depends on the size of your cell pellet. We found that 1x10^7 pelleted cells have a volume of roughly 40ul. Plus 15ul RNP solution and 60ul nucleofection buffer makes 115ul total which can be nucleofected with 100ul Lonza cuvettes. If you have less cells you can use more nucleofection buffer to make the total volume 100ul. We found that at least 50% of the total solution should be nucleofection buffer. If your cell pellet is too big you can split it up into two nucleofections.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"E3DE2450D5EA11E88FE1CD455D41C74A","id":675733,"previous_id":675732,"previous_guid":"10CF6150D5EA11E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o05v","text":"Transfect cell suspension into 100ul nucleofection cuvette and electroporate using the a Lonza 4D X nucleofector. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":31,"length":27,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"71a4h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"dufos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"c7k7c","text":"Check with Lonza for the best nucleofection settings for your cell type. We find that FF-120 works great for K562 and DJ-110 works great for B16-F10 cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"CBB99C50D5EB11E8863F551A53F5884F","id":675766,"previous_id":675733,"previous_guid":"E3DE2450D5EA11E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"altob","text":"After nuclefection, let cells sit at RT in cuvette for 5 mins. Then transfer cells into culture plates with prewarmed complete media and incubate at 37C and 5% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"646B6C80D5EC11E8863F551A53F5884F","id":675767,"previous_id":675766,"previous_guid":"CBB99C50D5EB11E8863F551A53F5884F","section":"RNP editing of cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c00uq","text":"Spin at 2000 \u00d7 rcf for 3 min at 4 \u00b0C in a tabletop centrifuge. Pour off S\/N.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"853D25F0D5EE11E8863F551A53F5884F","id":675769,"previous_id":675724,"previous_guid":"F32AA4E0D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8i42f","text":"Pellet nuclei in tabletop centrifuge by spinning at 2000 \u00d7 rcf for 3 min at 4 \u00b0C. Pour off S\/N","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A11AEFF0D5EE11E8863F551A53F5884F","id":675771,"previous_id":675725,"previous_guid":"F32C5290D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bbh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aph95","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"e1tg0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ben5h","text":"Add 100 \u03bcl magnetic beads (Invitrogen, Dynabeads) \u2013 protein A to 1.5 ml microfuge tubes. Add 1 ml block solution (0.5% BSA (w\/v) in PBS). If you have multiple IPs you can scale up accordingly to the number of IPs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":21,"style":"bold"},{"offset":93,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cjslt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7unj","text":"e.g.: 3 IPs: use 300ul of beads (still wash with 1ml of Block solution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2gsp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"811p4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9dulc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"d1aut","text":"This section is optional. We like to pre-incubate the magnetic beads with the antibody and then use bead-antibody complexes for the IP. You can however also add the antibody to lysates directly and then collect Antibody-Antigen complexes with beads afterwards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"reagents","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":129076,"guid":"145F4860D5F611E89D8BEDCF70F4819B","align":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Dynabeads Protein A","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"","sku":"10002D","url":"https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/order\/catalog\/product\/10002D?SID=srch-srp-10002D","vendor":{"name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/us\/en\/home.html","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":95},"can_edit":0,"step_guid":"C511AC90D5EF11E89D8BEDCF70F4819B","public":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"C511AC90D5EF11E89D8BEDCF70F4819B","id":675786,"previous_id":675723,"previous_guid":"96712800D5E711E88FE1CD455D41C74A","section":"Prebinding of antibody to magnetic beads"}
steps.section: Prebinding of antibody to magnetic beads

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"fg62a","text":"Collect the beads using magnetic stand. Remove supernatant. Wash beads in 1ml block solution two more times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":74,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7har6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6llkn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"97sj6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"14hk7","text":"With all bead washes (here and subsequent after IP) it is important to touch the beads as little as possible with a pipette tip to avoid losing beads as beads stick to the pipette tip.
